name: cargo
description: Rust's build tool and package manager

hints.default: IMPORTANT: For comprehensive code quality checks (formatting, linting, testing, building), use the 'rust_quality_check' tool instead of VS Code tasks or running multiple cargo commands separately. It runs synchronously and provides complete results. For individual cargo operations, this tool now runs synchronously by default to ensure you receive complete results.
hints.build: Building in progress - review compilation output for warnings, plan deployment steps, or work on documentation.
hints.test: Tests running - analyze test patterns, consider additional test cases, or review code coverage strategies. For comprehensive quality checks including fmt, clippy, test, and build, use the 'rust_quality_check' tool instead.
hints.doc: Documentation building - consider reviewing doc comments, planning API improvements, or working on examples.
hints.check: Type checking in progress - plan refactoring opportunities or review code patterns while waiting.

options.name: future-incompat-report
options.description: Outputs a future incompatibility report at the end of the build

options.name: message-format
options.description: Error format [possible values: human, short, json, json-diagnostic-short, json-diagnostic-rendered-ansi, json-render-diagnostics]

options.name: verbose
options.description: Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)

options.name: quiet
options.description: Do not print cargo log messages

options.name: config
options.description: Override a configuration value (KEY=VALUE or PATH)

options.name: unstable
options.description: Unstable (nightly-only) flags to Cargo (use 'cargo -Z help' for details)

options.name: workspace
options.description: Build all packages in the workspace

options.name: exclude
options.description: Exclude packages from the build (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: tests
options.description: Build all targets that have `test = true` set

options.name: test
options.description: Build only the specified test target

options.name: benches
options.description: Build all targets that have `bench = true` set

options.name: bench
options.description: Build only the specified bench target

options.name: features
options.description: Space or comma separated list of features to activate

options.name: release
options.description: Build artifacts in release mode, with optimizations

options.name: profile
options.description: Build artifacts with the specified profile

options.name: jobs
options.description: Number of parallel jobs, defaults to # of CPUs (-j, --jobs <N>)

options.name: keep-going
options.description: Do not abort the build as soon as there is an error

options.name: target
options.description: Build for the target triple (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: artifact-dir
options.description: Copy final artifacts to this directory (unstable)

options.name: build-plan
options.description: Output the build plan in JSON (unstable)

options.name: timings
options.description: Timing output formats (unstable) (comma separated): html, json

options.name: args
options.description: Arguments for the test binary (use after '--')

options.name: show-output
options.description: Show output from successful tests (equivalent to -- --show-output)

options.name: no-fail-fast
options.description: Run all tests regardless of failure

options.name: future-incompat-report
options.description: Outputs a future incompatibility report at the end of the build

options.name: message-format
options.description: Error format [possible values: human, short, json, json-diagnostic-short, json-diagnostic-rendered-ansi, json-render-diagnostics]

options.name: quiet
options.description: Display one character per test instead of one line

options.name: verbose
options.description: Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)

options.name: config
options.description: Override a configuration value (KEY=VALUE or PATH)

options.name: unstable
options.description: Unstable (nightly-only) flags to Cargo, see 'cargo -Z help' for details

options.name: package
options.description: Package to run tests for (see `cargo help pkgid`)

options.name: workspace
options.description: Test all packages in the workspace

options.name: exclude
options.description: Exclude packages from the test (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: tests
options.description: Test all targets that have `test = true` set

options.name: test
options.description: Test only the specified test target

options.name: benches
options.description: Test all targets that have `bench = true` set

options.name: bench
options.description: Test only the specified bench target

options.name: all-targets
options.description: Test all targets (does not include doctests)

options.name: features
options.description: Space or comma separated list of features to activate

options.name: jobs
options.description: Number of parallel jobs, defaults to # of CPUs (-j, --jobs <N>)

options.name: release
options.description: Build artifacts in release mode, with optimizations

options.name: profile
options.description: Build artifacts with the specified profile

options.name: target
options.description: Build for the target triple (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: timings
options.description: Timing output formats (unstable) (comma separated): html, json

positional_args.name: test
positional_args.description: Name of the integration test target (corresponds to `--test <NAME>`)

positional_args.name: testname
positional_args.description: Test name or filter to run (e.g., module::test_name)

subcommand.name: run
subcommand.description: Run a binary or example of the local package.

options.name: bin
options.description: Name of the binary to run

options.name: example
options.description: Name of the example to run

options.name: package
options.description: Package with the target to run

options.name: features
options.description: Space or comma separated list of features to activate

options.name: profile
options.description: Build artifacts with the specified profile

options.name: jobs
options.description: Number of parallel jobs, defaults to # of CPUs (-j, --jobs <N>)

options.name: quiet
options.description: Do not print cargo log messages

options.name: verbose
options.description: Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)

options.name: message-format
options.description: Error format [possible values: human, short, json]

options.name: args
options.description: Arguments to pass to the binary (use after '--')

subcommand.name: update
subcommand.description: Update dependencies in Cargo.lock to latest compatible versions

subcommand.name: install
subcommand.description: Install a Rust binary via cargo

subcommand.name: clippy
subcommand.description: Enhanced linting and code quality checks - returns immediately for incremental checks.

options.name: allow-dirty
options.description: Allow fixing when working directory is dirty

options.name: tests
options.description: Run clippy on tests as well

options.name: workspace
options.description: Run on all packages in the workspace

options.name: verbose
options.description: Use verbose output (-vv for very verbose)

subcommand.install_instructions: Install clippy using: rustup component add clippy

subcommand.name: fmt

options.name: check
options.description: Check if files are formatted without changing them

options.name: all
options.description: Format all packages in the workspace

options.name: quiet
options.description: Do not print cargo log messages (-q)

subcommand.install_instructions: Install rustfmt using: rustup component add rustfmt

subcommand.name: nextest
subcommand.install_instructions: Install cargo-nextest using: cargo install cargo-nextest --locked

subcommand.name: run
subcommand.description: Run tests using nextest. Waits for completion and returns full test results.

options.name: color
options.description: Produce color output: auto, always, never [env: CARGO_TERM_COLOR=] [default: auto]

options.name: tool-config-file
options.description: Tool-specific config files in the format 'tool:abs_path'. May be specified multiple times; later files are lower priority.

options.name: override-version-check
options.description: Override checks for the minimum version defined in nextest's config

options.name: profile
options.description: The nextest profile to use [env: NEXTEST_PROFILE=]

options.name: workspace
options.description: Run tests for all packages in workspace

subcommand.install_instructions: Install cargo-nextest using: cargo install cargo-nextest --locked

subcommand.name: show
subcommand.description: Show results/logs from a previous nextest run. If no run_id is provided, shows the most recent run.

options.name: run_id
options.description: ID of the nextest run to show (if omitted, show latest run)

options.name: json
options.description: Output results in JSON format if supported

options.name: open
options.description: Open the HTML report in a browser if available

options.name: workspace
options.description: Scope the operation to the workspace when applicable

subcommand.install_instructions: Install cargo-nextest using: cargo install cargo-nextest --locked

options.name: benchname
options.description: If specified, only run benches containing this string in their names (positional argument)

options.name: args
options.description: Arguments passed to the bench binary (use after '--')

options.name: no-fail-fast
options.description: Run all benchmarks regardless of failure

options.name: message-format
options.description: Error format [possible values: human, short, json, json-diagnostic-short, json-diagnostic-rendered-ansi, json-render-diagnostics]

options.name: verbose
options.description: Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)

options.name: quiet
options.description: Do not print cargo log messages

options.description: Override a configuration value (KEY=VALUE or PATH)

options.description: Unstable (nightly-only) flags to Cargo (use 'cargo -Z help' for details)

options.description: Benchmark all packages in the workspace

options.name: exclude
options.description: Exclude packages from the benchmark (can be specified multiple times)

options.description: Benchmark all targets that have `test = true` set

options.description: Benchmark only the specified test target

options.name: benches
options.description: Benchmark all targets that have `bench = true` set

subcommand.name: llvm-cov
subcommand.description: Run tests and collect coverage data via cargo llvm-cov.

options.name: no-report
options.description: Do not generate a coverage report

options.name: fail-under-lines
options.description: Fail if line coverage is below percentage

subcommand.install_instructions: Install cargo-llvm-cov using: cargo install cargo-llvm-cov

subcommand.name: audit

options.name: ignore
options.description: Advisory id to ignore (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: target-arch
options.description: filter vulnerabilities by CPU (default: no filter). Can be specified multiple times

options.name: target-os
options.description: filter vulnerabilities by OS (default: no filter). Can be specified multiple times

subcommand.install_instructions: Install cargo-audit using: cargo install cargo-audit

subcommand.name: version
subcommand.description: Show cargo version information - returns immediately.

subcommand.name: metadata
subcommand.description: Output the resolved dependencies and package metadata as JSON - returns immediately.

options.name: filter-platform
options.description: Only include resolve dependencies matching the given target-triple

options.name: no-deps
options.description: Output information only about the workspace members and don't fetch dependencies

options.description: Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)

options.description: Do not print cargo log messages

options.description: Unstable (nightly-only) flags to Cargo (use 'cargo -Z help' for details)
